intro: Scabiosa mansenensis f. alpina, commonly known as the alpine scabious, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators in mountain ecosystems.
